required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: To Investigate the Multiple Dose Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics of WCK 4282 (FEP-TAZ)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Randomized, Double-Blind Study to Investigate the Multiple Dose Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics of WCK 4282 (FEP-TAZ) After Intravenous Administrations in Healthy Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetics (PK) of multiple IV doses of FEP-TAZ 4 g (2 g cefepime + 2 g tazobactam) administered every 8 hours (q8h) in healthy adult volunteers for 10 days.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Subjects will receive one of the following IV treatments as a q8h infusion (90 min) regimen for 10 days: FEP-TAZ 4 g (2 g cefepime + 2 g tazobactam) (n=16) Placebo (n=4)
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by number of abnormal clinical laboratory test result
To measure the Area Under the Curve [AUC]
Safety assessed by number of abnormal physical examinations findings.
Safety assessed by number of abnormal vital signs findings
Safety assessed by number of abnormal 12 Lead ECG findings

clinical_study.condition: Antibiotics Causing Adverse Effects in Therapeutic Use

arm_group.description: FEP-TAZ 4 g (2 g cefepime + 2 g tazobactam) IV treatments as a q8h infusion (90 min) regimen for 10 days

intervention.description: FEP-TAZ 4 g (2 g cefepime + 2 g tazobactam) IV treatments as a q8h infusion (90 min) regimen for 10 days

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Have a body Mass Index (BMI) between 18 to 32 kg/m2 (both inclusive).
- Medical history without any major pathology.
- A sustained supine systolic blood pressure <150 mm Hg or >90 mm Hg or a supine diastolic blood pressure <95 mm Hg or >50 mm Hg at Screening or Check-in (Day -1). Blood pressure may be retested once in the supine position.
- Glomerular filtration rate (GFR) > 80 mL/min, estimated by the Cockcroft-Gault equation.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Use of cefepime and/or tazobactam within 60 days prior to study drug administration.
- History or evidence of clinically relevant pathology which might compromise the haemopoietic, renal, hepatic, endocrine, pulmonary, central nervous, cardiovascular, immunological, dermatological, gastrointestinal or any other body system.
